botanical_details.genus: Chrysanthemum are erect woody-based perennials with aromatic, pinnately lobed leaves and flowerheads of diverse form, from late summer to late autumn

how_to_grow.cultivation: In milder areas grow all year round in moist but well-drained soil in full sun in a sheltered position, and overwinter with a coarse organic mulch such as bark chips or bracken; in colder areas, overwinter in containers in a frost-free place such as a cool conservatory; for more advice see chrysanthemum cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by division in spring or by basal softwood cuttings in spring
how_to_grow.pests: May be affected by aphids, chrysanthemum leaf miner, leaf and bud eelworms, earwigs, capsid bug and glasshouse red spider mite
how_to_grow.diseases: Chrysanthemums may be affected by powdery mildews, grey moulds and other fungal rots, virus diseases, and rust diseases, especially chrysanthemum white rust; 'Prelude Apricot' is said to be tolerant of chrysanthemum white rust
